about-me.title: Goal-Oriented Therapy
about-me.paragraph:
I focus on providing professional support to those facing various mental challenges, whether it's anxiety, depression, excessive stress, feeling overwhelmed, self-esteem issues, or relationship difficulties. In my work, I combine elements of cognitive-behavioral therapy, mindfulness, and schema therapy. I work under regular supervision.

My goal is to create a safe space where you can feel understood, prioritize yourself, and together we will find ways to help you start feeling better as soon as possible. Therapy is tailored to your individual needs, and we will work together to achieve lasting changes that lead to a more fulfilling and balanced life.
about-me.subtitle: A Few Words About Me
about-me.subparagraph: I am a psychologist, lecturer, and therapist, working at the National Institute of Mental Health. I host a podcast on relationships and continually expand my education – both through my doctoral studies in clinical psychology at Charles University and through various courses and activities in the field of mental health.

content.title: Mutual Trust
content.text: At the first meeting, I will introduce you to the therapeutic approach I work with, and you will tell me what brings you here. Through a half-hour conversation, we will mutually decide whether and on what we will work during the individual sessions.

content.title: Safe Environment
content.text: Available both online and in my office in Vinohrady, Prague. What does the space look like?

content.title: Terms of Collaboration
content.text: Payment possible by cash or card. Predefined cancellation policies. The price for the initial consultation is 200 CZK. Subsequent consultations are priced from 1200 CZK (50 minutes).

questions.question: What are the sessions like?
questions.answer: Each session lasts 50 minutes. During the first three meetings, you will describe your situation in more detail. I ask additional questions, and together we set the goals for our collaboration. Each session is based on open conversation, asking open-ended questions, psychoeducation on relevant topics, moments of reflection, and the use of specific methods. These elements help change the perspective on the situation and allow for a more flexible approach to the topic.

questions.question: How often will we meet?
questions.answer: At the beginning, we will meet once a week. After the initial phase of therapy, we will meet 1-2 times a month. Maintenance sessions can then be 1x every 2-3 months. However, the frequency is always based on mutual agreement, and we can adjust it according to your preferences.

questions.question: Do I need to bring anything?
questions.answer: Some clients like to take notes during therapy, so a notebook might come in handy. Otherwise, you don't need anything. I will offer you water or tea during the session.

questions.question: When should I arrive?
questions.answer: Ideally, arrive right on time as there is no waiting room in my therapy office.

questions.question: Can we meet online? And how does it work?
questions.answer: Online meetings are no problem, and some clients prefer this option due to time constraints. We meet on Zoom, and I will send you a link before the session.

questions.question: How will I pay?
questions.answer: You can pay either in cash on the spot or via bank transfer (always within 24 hours after the session).

list.name: Jessie
list.text: Therapeutic sessions with Marie allowed me to reflect on various changes and challenges happening in my life. She created a calm and friendly atmosphere where I could share even vulnerable things. Our sessions brought positive changes and growth in my personal life.

list.name: L. X.
list.text: I was glad to have found a therapist like Marie, as the sessions with her helped me a lot and gave me different tools to manage my problems. One of the main factors that helped me in the therapy process was the pleasant atmosphere and open communication that Marie was able to create. It helped me be open not only with the therapist but also with myself.
